page.title: 08Ecology : Nature Reserve
page.content: ECOLOGY:Nature Reserve-Introduction The nature reserve lies between the Royal Seaforth dock complex and Crosby Marina.There are two large pools on site separated by a narrow causeway. The pool nearest the River Mersey is of sea-water,the inner pool of fresh water.The whole site consists of areas reclaimed from the sea by tipping material and separated from the sea by a revetment of huge limestone blocks. There is a radar tower in the north west corner of the site and a pump houseto the south west which,at high tide,pumps sea water from the Mersey into the outer pool.This water then flows into the dock complex.
